questions.prompt: Every local minimum of a convex optimization problem is a global minimum.
questions.explanation: This is a fundamental property of convex optimization that makes it tractable.

questions.prompt: Second-order cone programming (SOCP) involves constraints of the form:
questions.explanation: SOCP constraints have the form ||Ax + b|| ≤ cᵀx + d, defining a second-order (Lorentz) cone.

questions.prompt: In geometric programming, a _____ is a sum of monomials.
questions.explanation: A posynomial is a function of the form Σcᵢx₁^(aᵢ₁)···xₙ^(aᵢₙ) with cᵢ > 0, which becomes convex after log transformation.

questions.prompt: Convex optimization problems can always be solved in polynomial time.
questions.explanation: Convex optimization problems can be solved to arbitrary precision in polynomial time using interior-point methods.

questions.prompt: What transformation makes geometric programming convex?
options: Log transformation of variables and objective
questions.explanation: Taking logarithms of variables (yᵢ = log xᵢ) transforms posynomial geometric programs into convex problems.

questions.prompt: Quadratic programming is a special case of semidefinite programming.
questions.explanation: QP can be formulated as SDP by expressing the quadratic form as a matrix constraint.

questions.prompt: In robust optimization, the uncertainty set should be:
questions.explanation: A convex uncertainty set keeps the robust counterpart tractable, often remaining convex.

questions.prompt: A quasiconvex function has what property?
questions.explanation: Quasiconvexity is defined by having convex sublevel sets, which is weaker than convexity.

questions.prompt: The max-cut SDP relaxation provides a _____ bound for the integer program.
questions.explanation: SDP relaxations of combinatorial problems provide upper bounds (for maximization) that can be used in approximation algorithms.

questions.prompt: For matrix X ⪰ 0 to hold, all eigenvalues must be:
questions.explanation: Positive semidefinite (⪰ 0) requires all eigenvalues ≥ 0. Positive definite (≻ 0) requires all eigenvalues > 0.

questions.prompt: Quasiconvex optimization can be solved by bisection on the objective value.
questions.explanation: Quasiconvex problems can be solved by binary search on α, checking feasibility of {x : f(x) ≤ α} at each step.

questions.prompt: The worst-case robust optimization formulation min_x max_{u∈U} f(x,u) is:
options: Convex if f is convex in x for each u and U is convex
Convex only if U is a singleton
questions.explanation: The pointwise maximum over u preserves convexity in x if each f(·,u) is convex and U is convex.

questions.prompt: Which problem class is most general?
questions.explanation: SDP is most general: LP ⊂ SOCP ⊂ SDP. Each can be reformulated as the next more general class.

questions.prompt: The Goemans-Williamson algorithm uses SDP to achieve a _____ approximation for Max-Cut.
questions.explanation: The Goemans-Williamson algorithm uses SDP relaxation with randomized rounding to achieve a 0.878-approximation ratio for Max-Cut.
